pgrid.interfaces.storage
Class PGridStorageFactory

java.lang.Object
  p2p.storage.StorageFactory
      pgrid.interfaces.storage.PGridStorageFactory

public class PGridStorageFactory
extends StorageFactory

Factory that defines the operations that create various objects of the Storage subsystem. It is recommended to instantiate such types only through a concrete implementation of this factory to avoid hard-coding direct references to them. This class provides static methods to find concrete factories using the reflection API to further decouple the subsystem from its client.

Version:
1.0.0
Author:
@author Roman Schmidt

Field Detail

SHARED_INSTANCE

protected static final PGridStorageFactory SHARED_INSTANCE
The reference to the only instance of this class (Singleton pattern). This differs from the C++ standard implementation by Gamma et.al. since Java ensures the order of static initialization at runtime.

See Also:
Lazy instantiation - Balancing performance and resource usage
Constructor Detail

PGridStorageFactory

protected PGridStorageFactory()
The constructor must be protected to ensure that only subclasses can call it and that only one instance can ever get created. A client that tries to instantiate PGridIndexManager directly will get an error at compile-time.

Method Detail

sharedInstance

public static PGridStorageFactory sharedInstance()
This creates the only instance of this class. This differs from the C++ standard implementation by Gamma et.al. since Java ensures the order of static initialization at runtime.

Returns:
the shared instance of this class.
See Also:
